channel.title: Seminar: Big Sur
channel.description:
Discussion and lecture series from Esalen Institute at Big Sur, Calif., headed by Michael H. Murphy devoted to exploring the psychological nature of man.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: The unconscious and creativity, part two
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents a discussion led by Dr. Rollo May.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Self-actualization and the peak experience, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion led by Dr. Abraham Maslow of Brandeis University and author of Motivation of Personality, Toward a Psychology of Being, and Religions, Values and Peak Experiences.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Development of the individual, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion led by Dr. Carl Rogers, the principal founder of "client-centered therapy."
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Self-actualization and the peak experience, part one

item.title: The individual and the intensive group experience, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents the second portion of a discussion led by Dr. Carl Rogers, the principal founder of "client-centered therapy."
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Scientific approach to the unconscious, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, presents the second portion of a discussion led by Dr. Rollo May.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Human potentiality and the evaluation process, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a lecture by Dr. Gardner Murphy, director of research, Menninger Foundation, Topeka, Kansas.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: What does it mean, to know thyself?, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents the fourth portion of a discussion led by Dr. Rollo May.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: LSD and human potentiality, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion by Dr. Sidney Cohen, author of The Beyond Within, a survey of LSD research.
item.dc:creator: Esalen Institute
item.dc:subject: Science & Technology

item.title: Human freedom and dignity, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a discussion led by B.F. Skinner.
